p: The YFV was introduced into people in the Americas during the slave trade with West Africa 400 years ago [ 3]. Sylvatic cycles developed in South America as local NHPs became infected, mainly howler monkeys ( Alouatta spp.), squirrel monkeys ( Saimiri spp.), spider monkeys ( Ateles spp.) and owl monkeys ( Aotus spp.). Transmission of the YFV in the NHPs was established by infection of local mosquitoes that were capable of transmitting the YFV, mainly Haemagogus albomaculatus, Haemagogus spegazzini, Haemagogus janthinomys, Sabethes chloropterus, Sabethes albipivus, Sabethes glaucodaemon, Sabethes soperi and Sabethes cyaneus [ 3, 82].
